result.execSummary:
The defendant Olivia Jean Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs, surcharges & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.
Submit DNA sample.
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Olivia Jean Erickson

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Defendant Olivia Jean Erickson in court with Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State complied with Victim Witness Notification.   Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law.  Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found.  Joint recommendation - noting no restitution was requested.  Guilty plea entered.  Court disposition.  0 credit if revoked.  Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

10:41 AM Defendant Olivia Jean Erickson in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Olivia Jean Erickson.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
